This module contains support to manipulate windows and standard windows controls. There are two ways to find a specified window. windows() iterator, or enumerate() template. The main difference is that inside the iterator, it must create a seq of all windows and then yield one by one. However, the enumerate() template can be break during enumeration if specified window is found. Moreover, the enumerate() template can aslo collect the window that match the specified condition.

Procs

proc `$`(x: Window): string {...}{.borrow.}
The stringify operator for a window. 
proc `==`(x, y: Window): bool {...}{.borrow.}
Checks for equality between two window. 
proc repr(x: Window): string {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns string representation of a window. 
proc getHandle(window: Window): HWND {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the Win32 hWnd from the specified window. 
proc getTitle(window: Window): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the full title from a window. 
proc setTitle(window: Window; title: string) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Changes the title of a window. 
proc getClassName(window: Window): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the class name from a window. 
proc getText(window: Window; detectHidden = false): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the text from a window. 
proc getStatusBarText(window: Window; index = 0): string {...}{.raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Retrieves the text from a standard status bar control. 
proc getPosition(window: Window; pos: wPoint = (0, 0)): wPoint {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the screen coordinates of specified window position. 
proc getPosition(window: Window; x: int; y: int): wPoint {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the screen coordinates of specified window position.

Examples:

import
  mouse

proc example() =
  move(activeWindow().position(100, 100))

proc setPosition(window: Window; pos: wPoint) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Moves a window. 
proc setPosition(window: Window; x: int; y: int) {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Moves a window. 
proc getClientPosition(window: Window; pos: wPoint = (0, 0)): wPoint {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the screen coordinates of specified client-area coordinates. 
proc getClientPosition(window: Window; x: int; y: int): wPoint {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the screen coordinates of specified client-area coordinates.

Examples:

import
  mouse

proc example() =
  move(activeWindow().clientPosition(100, 100))

proc setSize(window: Window; size: wSize) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Resizes a window.

Resizes a window.

Retrieves the position of a given window. 
proc getRect(window: Window): wRect {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the position and size of a given window. 
proc setRect(window: Window; rect: wRect) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Moves and resizes a window. 
proc setRect(window: Window; x: int; y: int; width: int; height: int) {...}{.inline, raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Moves and resizes a window. 
proc getCaretPos(window: Window): wPoint {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the coordinates of the caret in the given window (works for foreground window only). 
proc getClientSize(window: Window): wSize {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the size of a given window's client area. 
proc getProcess(window: Window): Process {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the process associated with a window. 
proc getParent(window: Window): Window {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the parent of a given window. 
proc getChildren(window: Window): seq[Window] {...}{.raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Retrieves the children of a given window. 
proc getActiveWindow(): Window {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Get the currently active window 
proc setTransparent(window: Window; alpha: range[0 .. 255]) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Sets the transparency of a window. A value of 0 sets the window to be fully transparent. 
proc getTransparent(window: Window): int {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the transparency of a window. Return -1 if failed. 
proc setOnTop(window: Window; flag = true) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Change a window's "Always On Top" attribute. 
proc isExists(window: Window): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks to see if a specified window exists. 
proc isVisible(window: Window): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks to see if a specified window is currently visible. 
proc isEnabled(window: Window): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks to see if a specified window is currently enabled. 
proc isActive(window: Window): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks to see if a specified window is currently active. 
proc isMinimized(window: Window): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks to see if a specified window is currently minimized. 
proc isMaximized(window: Window): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks to see if a specified window is currently maximized. 
proc isFocused(window: Window): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks to see if a specified window has the focus. 
proc activate(window: Window) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Activates (gives focus to) a window. 
proc close(window: Window) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Closes a window. 
proc kill(window: Window; byProcess = true) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Forces a window to close by terminating the related process or thread. 
proc show(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Shows window. 
proc hide(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Hides window. 
proc enable(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Enables the window. 
proc disable(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Disables the window. 
proc minimize(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Minimize the window. 
proc maximize(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Maximize the window. 
proc restore(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Undoes a window minimization or maximization 
proc minimizeAll() {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Minimizes all windows. Equal to send("#m"). 
proc minimizeAllUndo() {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Undoes a previous minimizeAll(). Equal to send("#+m"). 
proc focus(window: Window) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Focus a window. 
proc click(window: Window; button = mbLeft; pos = wDefaultPoint; clicks = 1) {...}{.raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Sends a mouse click command to a given window. The default position is center. 
proc click(window: Window; item: MenuItem) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Invokes a menu item of a window. 
proc flash(window: Window; flashes = 4; delay = 500; wait = true) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Flashes a window in the taskbar.

Iterators

iterator windows(): Window {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Iterates over all the top-level windows. 
iterator windows(parent: Window): Window {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Iterates over the children that belong to the specified parent window. 
iterator allWindows(): Window {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Iterates over all top-level windows and their descendants. 
iterator allWindows(parent: Window): Window {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Iterates over all the descendants that belong to the specified window. 
iterator menuItems(window: Window): MenuItem {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Iterates over all the menu items in the specified window.

Examples:

import
  strutils

proc example() =
  for window in windows():
    if window.className == "Notepad":
      for item in window.menuItems:
        if "Ctrl+O" in item.text:
          window.click(item)
      break

Templates

template enumerate(body: untyped): untyped
Enumerates all the top-level windows. A window symbol is injected into the body. The template can return a seq[Window] that collects all window if the body can be evaluated as true. Use enumerateBreak template to break the enumeration.

Examples:

proc example() =
  echo enumerate(window.title != "")

Examples:

proc example() =
  enumerate:
    if window.className == "Notepad":
      echo window.title
      enumerateBreak

template enumerate(parent: untyped; body: untyped): untyped
Enumerates the children that belong to the specified parent window. A window symbol is injected into the body. The template can return a seq[Window] that collects all window if the body can be evaluated as true. Use enumerateBreak template to break the enumeration.

Examples:

proc example() =
  enumerate:
    if window.className == "Notepad":
      enumerate(window):
        echo window.className
      enumerateBreak

template enumerateAll(body: untyped): untyped
Enumerates all top-level windows and their descendants. A window symbol is injected into the body. The template can return a seq[Window] that collects all window if the body can be evaluated as true. Use enumerateBreak template to break the enumeration.

Examples:

proc example() =
  enumerateAll:
    if window.className == "Button" and window.title != "":
      echo window.repr

template enumerateAll(parent: untyped; body: untyped): untyped
Enumerates all the descendants that belong to the specified window. A window symbol is injected into the body. The template can return a seq[Window] that collects all window if the body can be evaluated as true. Use enumerateBreak template to break the enumeration.

Examples:

proc example() =
  enumerate:
    if window.className == "Notepad":
      enumerateAll(window):
        echo window.className
      enumerateBreak

template waitAny(condition: untyped; timeout: untyped = 0): untyped
Repeatly examines all the top-level windows until condition becomes true for any window. A window symbol is injected into the condition. timeout specifies how long to wait (in seconds). Default (0) is to wait indefinitely. The template can return the window that match the condition.

Examples:

proc example() =
  waitAny(window.className == "Notepad" and window.isActive)

template waitAll(condition: untyped; timeout: untyped = 0): untyped
Repeatly examines all the top-level windows until condition becomes true for all window. A window symbol is injected into the condition. timeout specifies how long to wait (in seconds). Default (0) is to wait indefinitely.

Examples:

proc example() =
  waitAll(window.className != "Notepad")

Made with Nim.
